alert.note: Alert for Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 17 at 2:52PM CST until November 18 at 9:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...LAKE-EFFECT SNOW SHOWERS EXPECTED TO RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS IN THE SNOWBELT LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY MORNING... .Occasional light snow and flurries will continue early this afternoon. Heavier lake-effect snow showers will begin to affect the area during the late afternoon hours, continue overnight, and then diminish Friday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Periods of snow showers, heavy at times. A total snow accumulation ranging from of 4 to 10 inches in the snowbelt of northern and western Vilas county...to a couple inches in the Eagle River area. * WHERE...Vilas County. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow covered and slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An intense snow band with snowfall rates of over one inch per hour is likely to be embedded within the larger area of lake-effect snow showers. The best estimate is that the band will primarily affect areas north and west of Vilas county. There remains some uncertainty where the heaviest snow band will set up, so anyone with travel plans tonight or Friday morning should closely monitor later forecasts for updates.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
